required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Antiviral Activity of ACH-0141625 or Placebo in Combination With Peginterferon and Ribavirin in HCV Positive Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIa, Randomized, Double-blind (Subject and Investigator Blind, Sponsor Open), Placebo-controlled Trial to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Antiviral Activity of Oral ACH-0141625 in Combination With Pegylated Interferon Alpha-2a and Ribavirin in Two Segments, After 28 Days of Dosing and, Subsequently, After 12 Weeks of Dosing in Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Genotype 1

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate safety, tolerability and antiviral response of ACH-0141625 compared to Standard of Care in HCV positive subjects.

primary_outcome.description: Segment 1: Percentage of subjects with the following: adverse events, abnormal laboratory safety tests, dose reductions, interruptions, and discontinuations. Criteria for abnormal laboratory safety tests: treatment-emergent worsening DAIDs graded laboratory tests.

primary_outcome.measure: Segment 1 : Rapid Viral Response at Week 4 (RVR4)
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint for Segment 1 of the study was the percentage of subjects in each treatment group achieving RVR at Week 4 (HCV RNA< or equal to LOQ at the Week 4 visit).

Segment 2: Percentage of Subjects with the following: adverse events, abnormal laboratory safety tests and dose reductions, interruptions and discontinuations. Criteria for abnormal laboratory safety tests: treatment-emergent worsening DAIDs graded laboratory tests.
The primary efficacy endpoint for Segment 2 of the study was the percentage of subjects achieving cEVR (complete early virologic response), defined as undetectable HCV RNA at Week 12.

secondary_outcome.description: For Segment 1, the percentage of subjects in the virology population that achieved cEVR (complete early virologic response), defined as undetectable HCV RNA at Week 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Segment 2: RVR4 (Rapid Viral Response at 4 Weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: For Segment 2, the percentage of subjects in the virology population that achieved RVR4, defined as HCV RNA< or equal to LOQ at the Week 4 visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Segment 1 and Segment 2: End of Treatment Response
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of the Virology Population subjects that were reported as undetectable HCV RNA at the completion of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Segment 1 and Segment 2: Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks ( Three Months Post Dosing) (SVR12)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of the Virology Population subjects that achieved sustained virologic response, defined as HCV RNA < LOQ, at 12 weeks (three months) post dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Segment 1 and Segment 2: Sustained Virologic Response ( Six Months Post Dosing) (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of the Virology Population subjects that achieved sustained virologic response, defined as HCV RNA < LOQ, six months post dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Segment 1 and Segment 2: HCV RNA Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in log10 HCV RNA level by visit for the virology population

secondary_outcome.measure: Segment 1 and Segment 2: HCV RNA Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in log10 HCV RNA level by visit.

arm_group.description: 200 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a and ribavirin for 48 weeks
400 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks
800 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks
Placebo for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks
200 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 weeks plus Peg-IFN and ribavirin for up to a total of 24 or 48 weeks
400 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 weeks plus Peg-IFN and ribavirin for up to a total of 24 or 48 weeks
800 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 weeks plus Peg-IFN and ribavirin for up to a total of 24 or 48 weeks

intervention.description: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection
400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females 18 years and older
- Chronic hepatitis C Genotype 1 (as specified in the protocol)
- Treatment naive
- Females who are post-menopausal and amenorrheic must have a FSH at screening. Females of child bearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test at screening and baseline. Females must use a non hormonal method of contraception and must agree not to get pregnant during the study and for six months following the discontinuation of SOC.
- Fertile males must agree to use a condom and his female partner must agree to use one or more methods of contraception. Males must not donate sperm during the study and three months following the last exposure to RBV.
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI >36 kg/m2
- Pregnant or nursing females: or females of childbearing potential not willing to comply with contraceptive measures per protocol. Men whose female partners are pregnant or contemplating pregnancy. - Coinfection with HBV and/or HIV
- Other significant disease including liver disease
- History of drug or alcohol dependence or addiction within the past 6 months
- History of participation in a clinical trial with a protease inhibitor or previous treatment with a protease inhibitor, where at least one dose of the protease inhibitor was consumed.
- Use of herbal or homeopathic products, illicit drugs, cytochrome P450 (CYP 3A4/5 substrates, inducers or inhibitors, hormonal methods of contraception, corticosteroids, immunosuppressive, or cytotoxic agents within 28 days of first dose of study drug.
- Have a clinically significant laboratory abnormality at screening (as specified in protocol).
- Segment 1: Subjects with any history of decompensated liver disease defined as cirrhotic subjects with a Child-Pugh score of > or = to 7. Segment 2: Subjects who have had a liver biopsy that shows bridging fibrosis or cirrhosis.
- Nonalcoholic steatohepatitis if ballooning degeneration or Mallory bodies are present on liver biopsy.
- Subjects, who prematurely discontinued, interrupted or dose reduced prior Peg-IFN and Ribavirin therapy, due to noncompliance or safety issues.
- Encephalopathy or altered mental status of any etiology.
- History of moderate, severe or uncontrolled psychiatric disease (as specified in protocol).
- History of malignancy of any organ system treated or untreated within the past 5 years.
- Use of colony stimulating factor agents within 90 days prior to baseline.
- History of seizure disorder.
- History of known coagulopathy including hemophilia.
- Clinically of significant findings on fundoscopic or retinal examination at screening
- History of immunologically mediate disease.
- History of clinical evidence of chronic cardiac disease (as specified in protocol)
- Received concomitant systemic antibiotic, antifungals or antivirals for the treatment of active infection within 14 days prior to the first dose of the study drug (as specified in protocol)

facility.name: Weill Medical College of Cornell University
Bon Secours St. Mary's Hospital of Richmond

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 15 sites in the United States and 3 sites in Belgium between September 30, 2010 and January 3, 2012.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants screened within 4 weeks (Day -28 to -1) before administration of study drug. Subjects who meet all eligibility criteria were instructed to arrive at the study center on Baseline day for randomization to treatment assignment.

group.title: Segment 1: 200 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 Days
group.description: ACH-0141625: 200 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for 48 weeks

group.title: Segment 1: 400 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 Days
group.description: ACH-0141625: 400 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for 48 weeks

group.description: ACH-0141625: 800 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for 48 weeks

group.title: Segment 1: Placebo for 28 Days
group.description: Placebo: Powder in capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for 48 weeks

group.title: Segment 2: 200 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 Weeks
group.description: ACH-0141625: 200 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for up to 24 or 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for up to 24 or 48 weeks

group.description: ACH-0141625: 400 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for up to 24 or 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for up to 24 or 48 weeks

group.description: ACH-0141625: 800 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for up to 24 or 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for up to 24 or 48 weeks

baseline.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population, which was defined as all subjects randomized and treated with at least one dose of ACH 0141625 or Placebo. Subjects were analyzed according to the randomized treatment.

outcome.title: Segment 1: Safety
outcome.description: Segment 1: Percentage of subjects with the following: adverse events, abnormal laboratory safety tests, dose reductions, interruptions, and discontinuations. Criteria for abnormal laboratory safety tests: treatment-emergent worsening DAIDs graded laboratory tests.
outcome.population: The safety population, which was defined as all subjects randomized and treated with at least one dose of ACH-0141625 or Placebo. Subjects were analyzed according to the randomized treatment.

group.title: Segment 1: Placebo
group.description: Placebo for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks Placebo: Powder in capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

group.title: Segment 1: 200 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 200 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a and ribavirin for 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 200 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

group.title: Segment 1: 400 mg ACH-0141625

measure.title: Segment 1: Safety
measure.description: Segment 1: Percentage of subjects with the following: adverse events, abnormal laboratory safety tests, dose reductions, interruptions, and discontinuations. Criteria for abnormal laboratory safety tests: treatment-emergent worsening DAIDs graded laboratory tests.
measure.population: The safety population, which was defined as all subjects randomized and treated with at least one dose of ACH-0141625 or Placebo. Subjects were analyzed according to the randomized treatment.

outcome.title: Segment 1 : Rapid Viral Response at Week 4 (RVR4)
outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint for Segment 1 of the study was the percentage of subjects in each treatment group achieving RVR at Week 4 (HCV RNA< or equal to LOQ at the Week 4 visit).
outcome.population: Efficacy analysis was performed on the virology population (a subset of the ITT population) and included all subjects who had a baseline HCV RNA result and at least 1 post baseline HCV RNA result.

group.title: Segment 1: Placebo
group.description: Placebo for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks Placebo: Powder in capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

group.title: Segment 1: 200 mg ACH-0141625

group.title: Segment 1: 400 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 400 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 400 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

group.title: Segment 1: 800 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 800 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 800 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

measure.title: Segment 1 : Rapid Viral Response at Week 4 (RVR4)
measure.description: The primary efficacy endpoint for Segment 1 of the study was the percentage of subjects in each treatment group achieving RVR at Week 4 (HCV RNA< or equal to LOQ at the Week 4 visit).
measure.population: Efficacy analysis was performed on the virology population (a subset of the ITT population) and included all subjects who had a baseline HCV RNA result and at least 1 post baseline HCV RNA result.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is no difference between proportions of subjects in each treatment group achieving RVR4 at Week 4 of the study, while the alternative hypothesis is that the proportion of subjects achieving RVR4 at Week 4 increases with increasing doses of ACH-0141625.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiplicity, proportion in each treatment group achieving RVR4 are analyzed using a CochranArmitage test for trend among the ordered groups: placebo (considered zero dose), 200 mg ACH-1625, 400 mg ACH-1625, and 800 mg ACH-1625.
analysis.method_desc: Only if overall test for trend is significant are pairwise comparisons evaluated using p-values for the difference in proportions (placebo active).

analysis.groups_desc: To control for multiplicity, proportion in each treatment group achieving RVR4 are analyzed using a Cochran-Armitage test for trend among the ordered groups: placebo (considered zero dose), 200 mg ACH-1625, 400 mg ACH-1625, and 800 mg ACH-1625. Only if overall test for trend is significant are pairwise comparisons evaluated using p-values for the difference in proportions (placebo - active).

To control for multiplicity, proportion in each treatment group achieving RVR4 are analyzed using a Cochran-Armitage test for trend among the ordered groups: placebo (considered zero dose), 200 mg ACH-1625, 400 mg ACH-1625, and 800 mg ACH-1625. Only if overall test for trend is significant are pairwise comparisons evaluated using p-values for the difference in proportions (placebo - active).

To control for multiplicity, proportion in each treatment group achieving RVR4 are analyzed using a Cochran-Armitage test for trend among the ordered groups: placebo (considered zero dose), 200 mg ACH-1625, 400 mg ACH-1625, and 800 mg ACH-1625. Only if overall test for trend is significant are pairwise comparisons evaluated using p-values for the difference in proportions (placebo - active).

outcome.population: The safety population, which was defined as all subjects randomized and treated with at least one dose of ACH-0141625. Subjects were analyzed according to the randomized treatment.

measure.title: Segment 2: Safety
measure.description: Segment 2: Percentage of Subjects with the following: adverse events, abnormal laboratory safety tests and dose reductions, interruptions and discontinuations. Criteria for abnormal laboratory safety tests: treatment-emergent worsening DAIDs graded laboratory tests.
measure.population: The safety population, which was defined as all subjects randomized and treated with at least one dose of ACH-0141625. Subjects were analyzed according to the randomized treatment.

outcome.title: Segment 2: Complete Early Virologic Response (cEVR)
outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint for Segment 2 of the study was the percentage of subjects achieving cEVR (complete early virologic response), defined as undetectable HCV RNA at Week 12.
outcome.population: Per protocol virology population (a subset of the virology population) and included all randomized subjects who completed 12 weeks of ACH-0141625 dosing.

group.title: Segment 2: 200 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 200 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 weeks plus Peg-IFN and ribavirin for up to a total of 24 or 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 200 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

group.title: Segment 2 - 400 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 400 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 weeks plus Peg-IFN and ribavirin for up to a total of 24 or 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 400 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection Ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

group.title: Segment 2 - 800 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 800 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 weeks plus Peg-IFN and ribavirin for up to a total of 24 or 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 800 mg oral capsule once daily for 28 days Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection Ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

measure.title: Segment 2: Complete Early Virologic Response (cEVR)
measure.description: The primary efficacy endpoint for Segment 2 of the study was the percentage of subjects achieving cEVR (complete early virologic response), defined as undetectable HCV RNA at Week 12.
measure.population: Per protocol virology population (a subset of the virology population) and included all randomized subjects who completed 12 weeks of ACH-0141625 dosing.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is no difference between proportions of subjects in each treatment group achieving cEVR at Week 12 of the study, while the alternative hypothesis is that the proportion of subjects achieving cEVR at Week 12 increases with increasing doses of ACH-0141625.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control for multiplicity, proportion of subjects in each treatment group achieving cEVR are analyzed using a Cochran-Armitage test for trend among the ordered treatment groups: 200 mg ACH-1625, 400 mg ACH-1625, and 800 mg ACH-1625.
analysis.method_desc: Only if overall test for trend is significant are pairwise comparisons evaluated using p-values for the difference in proportions (placebo - active).

outcome.title: Segment 1: Complete Early Virologic Response (cEVR)
outcome.description: For Segment 1, the percentage of subjects in the virology population that achieved cEVR (complete early virologic response), defined as undetectable HCV RNA at Week 12.
outcome.population: Analysis for Segment 1 was performed on the virology population (which is the same as the ITT population) and included all subjects who had a baseline HCV RNA result and at least 1 post baseline HCV RNA result.

group.title: Segment 1: 200 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 200 mg ACH-0141625 for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a and ribavirin for 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 200 mg oral capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

group.title: Segment 1: Placebo
group.description: Placebo for 28 days plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a plus ribavirin for 48 weeks Placebo: powder in capsule once daily Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily

measure.title: Segment 1: Complete Early Virologic Response (cEVR)
measure.description: For Segment 1, the percentage of subjects in the virology population that achieved cEVR (complete early virologic response), defined as undetectable HCV RNA at Week 12.
measure.population: Analysis for Segment 1 was performed on the virology population (which is the same as the ITT population) and included all subjects who had a baseline HCV RNA result and at least 1 post baseline HCV RNA result.

outcome.title: Segment 2: RVR4 (Rapid Viral Response at 4 Weeks)
outcome.description: For Segment 2, the percentage of subjects in the virology population that achieved RVR4, defined as HCV RNA< or equal to LOQ at the Week 4 visit.
outcome.population: Per protocol virology population (a subset of the virology population) and included all randomized subjects who completed 4 weeks of ACH-0141625 dosing.

group.title: Segment 2: 200 mg ACH-0141625
group.description: 200 mg ACH-0141625 for 12 weeks plus Peg-IFN alpha-2a and ribavirin for 48 weeks ACH-0141625: 200 mg oral capsule once daily for 28 days or for 12 weeks Pegylated Interferon alpha-2a: 180 ug once a week by subcutaneous injection for 48 weeks ribavirin: 400 mg or 600 mg (am) and 600 mg (pm) capsules taken orally twice daily for 48 weeks

group.title: Segment 2: 400 mg ACH-0141625

measure.title: Segment 2: RVR4 (Rapid Viral Response at 4 Weeks)
measure.description: For Segment 2, the percentage of subjects in the virology population that achieved RVR4, defined as HCV RNA< or equal to LOQ at the Week 4 visit.
measure.population: Per protocol virology population (a subset of the virology population) and included all randomized subjects who completed 4 weeks of ACH-0141625 dosing.

outcome.title: Segment 1 and Segment 2: End of Treatment Response
outcome.description: The percentage of the Virology Population subjects that were reported as undetectable HCV RNA at the completion of treatment.
outcome.population: Segment 2 analyzed the Per Protocol Population, which includes all randomized subjects who completed 12 weeks of ACH-014625 dosing and an additional 12 weeks of Peg/Ribavirin dosing.

group.title: Segment 2: 400 mg ACH-0141625

measure.title: Segment 1 and Segment 2: End of Treatment Response
measure.description: The percentage of the Virology Population subjects that were reported as undetectable HCV RNA at the completion of treatment.
measure.population: Segment 2 analyzed the Per Protocol Population, which includes all randomized subjects who completed 12 weeks of ACH-014625 dosing and an additional 12 weeks of Peg/Ribavirin dosing.

outcome.title: Segment 1 and Segment 2: Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks ( Three Months Post Dosing) (SVR12)
outcome.description: The percentage of the Virology Population subjects that achieved sustained virologic response, defined as HCV RNA < LOQ, at 12 weeks (three months) post dosing.
outcome.population: Segment 2 analyzed the Per Protocol Population (PPP=all randomized subjects completing 12 wks of ACH-014625 + an extra 12 wks of Peg/RBV) who returned for SVR12.

outcome.title: Segment 1 and Segment 2: HCV RNA Change From Baseline
outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in log10 HCV RNA level by visit for the virology population
outcome.population: Efficacy analysis was performed on the virology population, which was a subset of the ITT population and included all subjects who had a baseline HCV RNA result and at least 1 post baseline HCV RNA result

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events data collected through end of treatment plus 4 weeks.
reported_events.desc: Treatment-emergent AEs presented: Day 1 through end of ACH-0141625/placebo treatment period plus 14 days. All SAEs reported during the study period are presented.

event.sub_title: Left Lower Extremity Deep Vein Thrombosis

event.description: Grade 3 ALT elevation occurred about Week 10. ACH-0141625 was held for four days, during which ALT decreased. Subject was re-challenged with ACH-0141625 for the remaining week of therapy, and ALT levels continued to improve, normalizing by Week 16.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Prior to submitting/presenting a manuscript or materials relating to a Study to a publisher, reviewer, or outside person, the Institution shall provide to Achillion a copy of all such manuscripts or materials, and Achillion shall have sixty (60) days to review and comment. The Institution shall, upon Achillion's request, further delay publication or presentation for a period of up to one hundred twenty (120) days to allow Achillion to protect its interests in any Achillion Inventions.
